website_summaries.verdict: The excellent Sennheiser HD6 Mix headphones reach down to the deepest lows and deliver them, along with the rest of the frequency range, accurately.
pros: Powerful, accurate frequency response with deep bass and excellent clarity throughout the range
Comes with two removable cablesâone coiled, one straight

customer_reviews.title: Can I give this 10 stars? AMAZING
customer_reviews.text: As a Live Audio Engineer I just cant tell in words how freaking cool this headphones are! Ideally for mixing either live or studio. Frequency response goes from 18 or 10 - 20000. everything is perfect from this headphones.... even when im not mixing a concert I just go on youtube open my fav equalizer and I feel im there! AMAZING
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good pair of headphones for music production
customer_reviews.text: Very good pair of headphones for music production. fairly balanced lows, midds and highs! if you are after hearing a true tone of your music the I would definitely recommend them! build quality is good. You get 2 types of ear pads with them, synthetic leather and some kind of velvet. 2 cables and an adapter from 3.5 to 1/4" As far as I understand all the connectors are gold plated for the better conductivity!
customer_reviews.author: Achikuda

customer_reviews.title: Great product, from a great company that makes solid quality.
customer_reviews.text: Probably my current favorite set of headphones. Great response on bass and very comfortable to wear. Actually fell asleep with the on and playing on accident. Good sound isolation and the extras that it comes with are great as well (hybrid case, two sets of audio cords, two sets of ear pads). Another home run from Sennheiser. Headband is built like a tank and is super comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Holt

customer_reviews.title: Very uncomfortable to wear, it puts so much pressure on my skull, PAINFUL!
customer_reviews.text: I used to respect Sennheiser products and bought this. Sound quality is okay. VERY uncomfortable to wear, it puts too much pressure on my skull! Also the headphone looks ugly. Boring engineers at Sennheiser should also know what good design means and have some aesthetic sense! It's not about sound only, it's how it feels when you wear it. Don't recommend anyone buying it!
customer_reviews.author: VGan

customer_reviews.title: Great Reference Headphones
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for in a pair of mixing headphones. Great sound isolation, great flat frequency response, and great transient response. Very happy with the headphones for the price. Like some say, they can get a bit tight and uncomfortable after a few hours of listening, but they absolutely get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: George P.

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Just want to add that these are not comfortable. If you take your fingers and gently push them between the soft region where your ear, jaw, and neck meet that's the sensation these headphones give. It gets worse the longer you sit with them.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Headphones!
customer_reviews.text: A Christmas gift for my college-radio-station-general-manager...who absolutely LOVES them. Sound is great and true frequency response... Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Robert Popichak

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality Without Paying a Huge Amount
customer_reviews.text: I use these headphones for video editing. I wanted something that was a good quality without paying a huge amount and this is perfect! I love that you can plug the cord into either side of the headphones depending on what works best for you, and that there are 2 cords, a straight and curly one. If you want good headphones for a not so hefty price these are perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Value for money.
customer_reviews.text: Great purchasing experience. Product is exactly as expected. Very good value for it's price. They are slightly dark (treble wise) and mid accentuated. But I knew that when I ordered them.
customer_reviews.author: hushi P

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable, good for extended periods(6-8 hours) of use for gaming/listening to music. Also, great clarity as well!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel T. Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Best headphones i own.
customer_reviews.text: these are the best headphones i've ever owned. i would say that they are able to mix and master tracks from the pros, like Martin Garrix, and Hardwell.
customer_reviews.author: hunter

customer_reviews.title: Love for mixing & DJ
customer_reviews.text: Great product, nice sound quality, very flat with low bass
customer_reviews.author: Luan H.

customer_reviews.title: Use with an amp
customer_reviews.text: These are great headphones for the money. I'm a musician and they do a very good job of passively attenuating outside noise. In response to some of the negative reviews, please note that these are high impedance phones (150ohms) and are not meant to be used with consumer products without an amp. The impedance is almost 5x more than that of Beats headphones for example. I bought a small $30 Fiios amp and it makes a big difference when plugged into my iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Greenfield

customer_reviews.title: It sounds excellent, kinda have to break them in the head ...
customer_reviews.text: It sounds excellent, kinda have to break them in the head band, its a bit tight at first, but really clear bass, the highs can be deceiving if used for monitoring but for overall listening they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound exactly what I was looking for as a ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent sound exactly what I was looking for as a gift for a dear musician. Superbe packaging...I will order another one for sure...!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and cost effective
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality is fantastic and well worth the price. My fiancé loves them and uses them when he does mixes.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: I like these a lot
customer_reviews.text: I like these a lot, very great sound quality, although I didn't realize that there would be minimal bass. Other than that, very good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for mixing music
customer_reviews.text: Great headphone. I can frequencies that I did hear before in my mix.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Snare

customer_reviews.title: Good for production, bad for vocals
customer_reviews.text: Update: Since I got these around the weekend I had to wait until Monday to return them and had some extra mixing to do while I waited, I don't know what happened but I think my ears adjusted and it sounds amazing actually incredible now, definitely worth the buy despite the first scare I had previously. Will be keeping. These are pretty good headphones for just production, I can tell cause every song (without vocals) sounds beautiful, But with vocals is a whole other story! For some reason the vocals always sound muddy in these headphones. No matter what type of song the vocals feel underwhelming and hurts my ears.
customer_reviews.author: RatedXT

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good for the price. Can't compare to my 650 but that's a whole difference price range and requires a good amp.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice cans
customer_reviews.text: These are a great value and seem very well built. I have not taken measurements, but they sound very flat across the spectrum to my trained ears. As other reviewers pointed out, these cans have reasonably high impedance and are geared toward monitoring on "professional" equipment. They will work in a pinch with your mobile player, but you will be missing some audio quality. These would be best paired with a headphone amp if you are looking to connect with a consumer player.
customer_reviews.author: bmk5140

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and the recipient is extremely happy with the product. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth  Pincus

customer_reviews.title: My son got this for his birthday. He loves ...
customer_reviews.text: My son got this for his birthday. He loves it. He uses it to listen to his music on his iPhone as well as uses it when he practices his guitar. They does cut out outside noises well which means I cannot get his attention when he is wearing them.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Home mixing and Mastering on a budget
customer_reviews.text: Great headphones! These are extremely flatt and made for mixing not really music listening. Def. plug them into an amp as you'll hear a drastic difference then plugged into your phone.
customer_reviews.author: Brian D.

customer_reviews.title: It looks and feels like driving a tank
customer_reviews.text: Amazing headset! Coming from a gamer headset, listening FLAK is like day and night compared with headsets like steelseries or razer. It comes with two different cables, adapters and a hard case!
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo Borjas

customer_reviews.title: Sennheiser means what they say . . .
customer_reviews.text: All but one review I was able to find sang the praises of these cans. However, that sole commentary found them lacking in presence, to which I would add they exhibit no semblance of life or sparkle whatsoever. In fact, Sennheiser's calling these "flat" is in fact an understatement; harmonics easily heard using other equipment are swallowed whole down a long tunnel. Two pieces of good news, however: Amazon's return policy; and I've now got a whole new degree of appreciation for my B&W P5's. I gave the HD6 MIX two stars only because my sample might simply be flawed--given the price, I certainly hope so. PS--Sadly, my Etymotics leave Sennheiser as much in the dust as the B&W's.
customer_reviews.author: jowct

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations, especially for the discounted price of $120.00. This my third set of Sennheiser headphones and I could not be more pleased. Solid build. Zero cable noise. The daisy fits my cell phone with the phone case on. These are bass heavy but also very accurate. It feels like you are listening to the artists in the studio. The HD6's are comfortable and don't feel too heavy. You will be distracted by the beautiful sound anyway. Completely satisfied and feel that this was a "well done" purchase. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent looks. So so sound.
customer_reviews.text: The looks, construction and comfort are excellent. The sound unfortunately brings the rating down. It is extremely bass heavy and lacks clarity and detail on the high end. Yes, breaking them in makes a slight improvement but not enough. If you get these at a reduced price and if you can use an equalizer to increase highs and reduce the lows you would have a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Mosessupposes

customer_reviews.title: Great sound - balanced and not weak in the low ...
customer_reviews.text: These are a huge step up from my old 280s! Great sound - balanced and not weak in the low end. They even sound pretty good using underpowered equipment. I don't reccomend these for the casual listener, since most people don't have hardware which can match the 150ohm impedence of these headphones. Very comfortable, unless your ears are abnormally large. A product deserving of the beautiful packaging it comes in.
customer_reviews.author: WKR

product_meta.title: SENNHEISER HD6MIX
product_meta.description: Designed to cater to the needs of the professional sound technician the HD6 MIX is constructed of rugged lightweight parts and built to withstand years of work in the studio. Sound-wise they deliver an accurate balanced sound reproduction suitable for mixing and monitoring. Their soft durable ear cushions ensure a comfortable fit even over extended periods of use while at the same time reducing background noise to a minimum so that you can concentrate on finding the perfect mix. At home in a studio environment the HD6 MIX is the right choice for those who use their headphones to create sounds that move the masses. Features Sennheiserrsquos proprietary acoustics system delivering a balanced and accurate sound. Elliptical circumaural design for maximum comfort and reduces background noise to a minimum in even the loudest of listening environments. 150 ohm impedance for optimum compatibility with studio and mixing equipment Crafted from durable high quality parts to guarantee years of use Single-sided coiled cable can be attached to either ear cup straight cable included (both up to 3m) Comes with a premium protective case Two year warranty
